Key Match Events: Los Angeles Dodgers committed three errors in a five-run 8th inning
Chicago Cubs rallied for the tying and go-ahead runs in a five-run 8th inning
Tommy Edman hit a solo home run twice in the third and fourth innings
Pete Crow-Armstrong made a terrific sliding catch on the warning track of Kiké Hernández to end the seventh
Evan Phillips allowed two runs and four hits in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: This was a matchup of Japanese star pitchers Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Shota Imanaga, pitching against each other for the first time in Major League Baseball
Cubs manager Craig Counsell praised the rivalry between Imanaga and Yamamoto, stating, 'They’ve traveled halfway around the world and they’re still competing against each other. That’s pretty cool.'
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts mentioned, 'It was a frustrating way to lose that game,' highlighting the mental mistakes made by the team
Max Muncy said, 'We got to eliminate that' referring to the mental mistakes that led to the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured Imanaga and Suzuki against Yamamoto and Shohei Ohtani
Suzuki finished 3 for 5 with a run
Ohtani was hitless in four at-bats
Yamamoto struck out his first four batters of his first start in nearly three months
Porter Hodge pitched the ninth for his fifth save
